Self-sensing Soft Tactile Actuator for Fingertip Interface

Summary

Along with my colleague Jung Hwan, we developed a self-sensing soft tactile actuator based on multilayered Dielectric elastomer actuator (DEA) for wearable haptic interfaces. To provide accurate physical force feedback to the user, the actuator is integrated with a 1.1 mm thick film-type soft force sensor that enables feedback control.

Read the paper...

Evaluation

  • The highest torque of 1.32 Nm was measured in the direction of extension motion. In addition, torques of 0.61, 0.90, 0.62 Nm were measured in the direction of flexion, radial deviation, and ulnar deviation.
  • The mass of the wearable part of the fabricated SWA is only 151 g, and the total mass of the robot including the pump and radiator is around 1 kg.

    • Sensor Demo Video

  • Even from the raw data, the sensor was able to measure fingertip forces with a fast response time.
  • The sensor was able to recognize different static and dynamic contact modes accurately after calibration.
